p: All of the chemicals utilized during the reactions were obtained from Spectrochem, India. 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectra were recorded at room temperature on Varian 400 MHz and 100 MHz spectrometers, respectively. Chemical shift values were displayed with reference to TMS as an internal standard. DMSO- d 6 was used as the solvent to prepare the samples. Chemical shifts were expressed in δ (ppm) and coupling constants ( J) in Hertz. The splitting pattern abbreviations are as follows: s, singlet; d, doublet; t, triplet; q, quartet; m, unresolved multiplet; dd, doublet of the doublet. Column chromatography was performed with Merck silica gel 60 (230–400 mesh). Analytical thin-layer chromatography was carried out using Merck silica gel 60F 254, and iodine was used as a developing reagent. IR spectra were recorded on an FTIR IR Affinity-1 Shimadzu spectrophotometer. The CHNS analysis was recorded on Elementar Vario El-III.
